question.body: Why will people die if their body temperature increases too much?

multiple_choice.choice: The body will under go spontaneous combustion.
The body’s metabolic reactions are interrupted.
The body will not be able to get enough calcium.
The body’s metabolic reactions will begin to go too fast.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The body will not spontaneously burst into flame.
Correct. The body’s metabolic reactions depend on proteins, if they get to hot they will lose their shape.
Incorrect. The amount of calcium in the body is not affected by the heat.
Incorrect. Although the reactions will speed up with the heat once a certain point is reached the proteins will lose their shape and stop working altogether.

question.body: In older people the ratio of SO fibers to FG fiber increases. This may result in:

response.feedback: Incorrect. In older people there may be less motor units activated which will decrease the muscle tension.
Incorrect. In older people there may be less motor units activated not more.
Incorrect. The decrease in FG movements will decrease the power.
Correct. The increase in SO fibers results in less powerful movements.

question.body: Endurance training can cause angiogenesis which is an example of how structure and function are related because:

multiple_choice.choice: There is an increase in capillaries to decrease the endurance of the muscles.
There is an increase in capillaries to increase the endurance of the muscles.
There is an increase in muscle fibers to to increase the atrophy of the muscle.
There is an increase in adipose tissue to increase the endurance of the muscle.

response.feedback: Incorrect. By increasing the capillaries, there is an increase of oxygen which increases the endurance of the muscle.
Correct. By increasing the capillaries, there is an increase of oxygen which increases the endurance of the muscle.
Incorrect. Atrophy is a decrease in muscle size.
Incorrect. An increase in adipose tissue will decrease the endurance and strength of the muscle.
